main event: A bright, saucer-shaped object was observed in the sky over Shade, Ohio in 1967.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a star, but it was moving rapidly and changing colors from blue-green to red to yellow.
The object appeared to be at a very high altitude and was observed for approximately 3-4 minutes before disappearing from view.
The witness described the object as brighter than the brightest stars and making a swishing sound like a light breeze.
The witness estimated the object's speed to be between 500-600 mph and its distance to be 60-70 yards away.
The object seemed to hover at a low altitude, then accelerated straight up at a high rate of speed and disappeared.
